text: Oftentimes, your Apple Watch will indicate
when it has low battery.
To manually check what percentage it's at,
swipe up on your clock face.
To charge your battery,
plug the charging cable into an outlet.
Take off your Apple Watch
and place it on the charging circle.
The back of the Apple Watch should meet

with the concave side
of the charging circle.

A magnet will help you
align the Apple Watch.

If you don't feel the magnet
on the charging circle
connecting to the Apple Watch
or can easily slide the Apple Watch away
from the charging circle,

you may be using the wrong
side of the charging circle.

When the Apple Watch is
connected to the charger,

a lightning bolt will
appear on the screen.

If the Apple Watch is
completely out of battery,
it may appear as a red lightning bolt
and will need a few seconds

before you're able to
interact with the screen.

Otherwise, a green
lightning bolt will appear.
The circle around the lightning bolt
indicates the progress of the charge.
When the circle is completed,
your Apple Watch will be 100% charged.
